Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: at top, frieze of outlined alternating added red and black tongues; below, black-figure decoration consisting of upper part of two warriors to left; from left, back of helmet with red band on crest, overlapping tongues; round shield with boar’s head device, with dabs of added red, on whitish background; creamy added white dots on whitish band probably between red bands at rim; of second warrior, Corinthian helmet with red band on crest; between the two heads, a diagonal line (possibly spear belonging to second warrior).
Curator's comments: There are traces of glue on the right edge of the sherd suggesting that a joining sherd has been lost, but there is no record of it in any documentation. A very corinthianising piece.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0171) (Phase 1)
